japanese: 迎撃されずに空母に乗り込む方法なんて無いぜ？

english: I have a way. Randall wants a Colonel named Taggart. He's sent me to find him. He's our key on to the Reagan.
japanese: ランドールはタガート大佐を探してる。 そのために俺がここにいるわけだが、彼が空母レーガンへのカギになる。
報告を。

english: Taggart's order lead directly to the collapse of the central Blue Zone.
japanese: タガート大佐の命令が軍制圧エリアを失うことに繋がりました。
よく戻った。
レッドライト作戦も終了だ。

english: What about our men? The ones on the ground in Manhattan...?
japanese: 兵士はどうしますか？まだマンハッタンにいる者もいますが……？

english: You didn't think I was that naive, did you? When you have a festering wound, you cauterize it.
japanese: 私がそんなに甘いと思っているのか？心にわだかまりがあるならそんなもの捨てされ。

english: We'll be saving millions of American lives.
japanese: 我々はアメリカ国民を救うことになるんだぞ。

english: I won't let you erase New York like you erased Hope.
japanese: ホープのようにニューヨークを消させはしないさ。
なんだと……？

english: We're six minutes out. And only I know the code.
japanese: しかしもうあと6分しかない、そして解除コードを知っているのは私だけだ。

english: You were at Hope, Idaho. You took something from Elizabeth Greene.
japanese: お前はホープにいた。 エリザベス・グリーンから何を奪った？

english: Because everyone I've killed -- they're in me. They are me.
japanese: 俺が全員殺したからな ―― 奴らは全員俺の中だ。 ブラックウォッチは俺だ。
一体どうやって……。

english: I know what BLACKWATCH has done.
japanese: ブラックウォッチがしたことは知っている。

english: You bastard. You could have stopped all this... You let it happen.
japanese: くそ野郎が。 お前は全て止められたはずなのにこんなこと引き起こしやがって……。

english: When the weapon detonates, and they think the infection is cleansed, they won't be looking for me.
japanese: 核が爆発して感染が止められたと思えば、誰も俺を探さないだろう。

english: And when I consume you, I'll be able to withstand...even this.
japanese: そしてお前を吸収すれば核でも耐えられる体になるってことか……。
放しやがれ！
ディナか！？

english: I'm not going to hurt you!
japanese: お前を傷つけはしない！
助けが必要なんだ。

english: *exhales* Jesus, I knew something fucked up was going on at GENTEK. What the hell happened to you, Alex?
japanese: 何て事、ジェンテック社で何かメチャクチャが起こってるのはわかってたけどさ。 アレックス、あんた何があったの？

english: I've been researching that whole fucked up organization for weeks. I was poking around to get YOU information.
japanese: この数週間あのトチ狂った組織全体を調べてたのよ。 あんたの情報を得る為に。

english: Don't you remember, you wanted to find out what was going on at the highest levels of GENTEK -- anything about the Director of Research. Do...
japanese: 憶えてない？ あんた、ジェンテックの上層部が何をしているのか探ろうとしてたのよ。 研究部主任についてとか全部……。
大丈夫？
何があったか知ってるか？

english: I...I haven't even seen you in five years. Not until you show up at my door last month.
japanese: アタシ……アタシは、先月あんたが訪ねて来るまで5年間、あんたの顔も見てなかったけど？

english: Is there somewhere we can go?
japanese: どこか隠れ家になりそうな所はあるか？

english: Yeah. I, um...I know a place.
japanese: そうね。 そう……1ヵ所心当たりがあるわ。
さあ、入って……。

english: It's, uh, it's a friend's place. They're gone for a year. Patagonia, or something.
japanese: ここは、あー、友達の家なんだけど。 1年ほど前から出かけてんのよ。 パタゴニアかどこかだったかなぁ。

english: Any idea what this all means?
japanese: この調査で何か見当はついたか？

english: No, but I'm going to find out. I mean this is the story of the century, so somebody's got to know what the fuck is going on here.
japanese: ううん、でも見つけ出してやるわ。 これは歴史的大事件よ、ここでどんな最悪な事が行われているのか誰かがスッパ抜いてやらなきゃ。

english: You know...they were waiting for me at my place, so...they're most definitely at yours.
japanese: 分かってると思うけど……奴らがアタシんちでアタシのこと待ち伏せしてたって事は……奴ら絶対にアンタの家にもいるわよ。
俺はどこに住んでた？

english: You'll be here when I get back?
japanese: 俺が戻るまでここで待っててくるか？

english: It's best you stay put -- they're probably combing the city for both of us.
japanese: それが最善だ ―― 奴ら俺達を街中探し回っているだろうしな。
そうだね。 ここにいる。
そこ。
助けが必要なんだ。

english: *exhales* Jesus, I knew something fucked up was going on at GENTEK. What the hell happened to you, Alex?
japanese: 何て事、ジェンテック社で何かメチャクチャが起こってるのはわかってたけどさ。 アレックス、あんた何があったの？

english: I've been researching that whole fucked up organization for weeks. I was poking around to get YOU information.
japanese: この数週間あのトチ狂った組織全体を調べてたのよ。 あんたの情報を得る為に。 憶えてない？

english: Don't you remember, you wanted to find out what was going on at the highest levels of GENTEK -- anything about the Director of Research. Do...
japanese: あんた、ジェンテックの上層部が何をしているのか探ろうとしてたのよ。 研究部主任についてとか全部……。
大丈夫？
わからない……。

english: I...I haven't even seen you in five years. Not until you show up at my door last month.
japanese: アタシ……アタシは、先月あんたが訪ねて来るまで5年間、あんたの顔も見てなかったけど？

english: Is there somewhere we can go?
japanese: どこか隠れ家になりそうな所はあるか？

english: Yeah. I, um...I know a place.
japanese: そうね。 そう……1ヵ所心当たりがあるわ。

english: AXIOM will sweep to the river. BRIMSTONE will encircle the entire sector and detain anyone moving through the area. I want this contained by daybreak.
japanese: アクシアムは河川を徹底的に捜索しろ。 ビムストーンは全ての地域を包囲しつつ、通過する人間を片っ端から検問しろ。 いいか、日没までに済ませるんだ。

english: But sir, there are nearly 100,000 people in the blue zone.
japanese: しかしながら将軍、対象地域の人口は10万に及びます。

english: I'm not interested in excuses. Get it done!
japanese: お前の意見など聞いていない。 さっさとやるんだ！

english: We have a situation I think your team is well suited for, Captain. How long until your men are in place?
japanese: どうやら君の出番が来たようだ、大尉。 君の部隊は展開までどのぐらいかかる？

english: We're prepped and waiting for orders. We can be wheels up and boots on the ground anywhere in the city in fifteen.
japanese: 我々の部隊は既に臨戦状態にあります。 ご命令があれば、車両部隊と歩兵部隊を15分で市内のどこにでも展開できます。

english: With respect, sir, a suppression operation in a city of twelve-million is slightly more than my men can handle.
japanese: 恐縮ながら、将軍、人口12万弱の都市ならば、我々の部隊だけで鎮圧可能ですが。

english: Uh, the situation has already evolved, Captain. You're not participating in the containment action. Your team has a single target: Alex Mercer. Codenamed ZEUS.
japanese: ふむ。 事態はもはやそんな段階を過ぎてしまっているのだよ、大尉。 君には封鎖任務とは別の作戦にあたってもらう。 目標はただ1つ ―― アレックス・マーサー、コードネーム「ゼウス」の排除だ。

english: He's carrying a new strain. He's eliminated fifty of my men and smashed through a two-foot steel door. You interested?
japanese: 彼は新型ウィルスのキャリアだ。 やつは私の部下を50人も殺し、おまけに60cmの鉄板をブチ破っている。 やれるか？
もちろんです、将軍。

english: I don't need to tell you what's at stake.
japanese: 失敗したらどうなるか、言うまでもないだろうな。
さあ、入って……。

english: It's, uh, it's a friend's place. They're gone for a year. Patagonia, or something.
japanese: ここは、あー、友達の家なんだけど。 1年ほど前から出かけてんのよ。 パタゴニアかどこかだったかなぁ。

english: Any idea what this all means?
japanese: この調査で何か見当はついたか？

english: No, but I'm going to find out. I mean this is the story of the century, so somebody's got to know what the fuck is going on here.
japanese: ううん、でも見つけ出してやるわ。 これは歴史的大事件よ、ここでどんな最悪な事が行われているのか誰かがスッパ抜いてやらなきゃ。

english: You know...they were waiting for me at my place, so...they're most definitely at yours.
japanese: 分かってると思うけど……奴らがアタシんちでアタシのこと待ち伏せしてたって事は……奴ら絶対にアンタの家にもいるわよ。
俺はどこに住んでた？

english: You'll be here when I get back?
japanese: 俺が戻るまでここで待っててくるか？

english: It's best you stay put -- they're probably combing the city for both of us.
japanese: それが最善だ ―― 奴ら俺達を街中探し回っているだろうしな。
そうだね。 ここにいる。
目標、建物に侵入！

english: Target is hot. Light it up!
japanese: そろそろいいだろう、爆破しろ！
何かわかったか？

english: Jesus Christ! Don't do that! Jes.... *exhales*
japanese: ジーザス ！なんなの！？……(息を吐く)
すまん。
いいよ。 あんたの家、どうだった？
何も残っちゃいなかった。

english: Well, it doesn't matter. I've been looking at your laptop.
japanese: まぁ、いいわ。 あんたのノートPCを調べてたとこよ。
ノートPC？

english: Yeah. It came in a package the day after you went AWOL. Look.
japanese: ええ。 あんたが無断欠勤した後で送られてきた。 見て。
俺は……その娘を見たことがある。

english: Well it makes sense. There are only two names in the file -- one is yours. The second is this woman: Elizabeth Greene....
japanese: かもね。 ファイルにあったのは、二人の名前だけ。 ひとつはあんた。 ふたつめはこの女、エリザベス・グリーン……。

english: She's still in isolation at the GENTEK building. Do you know who she is?
japanese: まだジェンテックビルに隔離されてる。 彼女のこと、知ってる？

english: Hey, whoever she is, she knows more than I do.
japanese: 彼女が誰だろうが何だろうが、知ってることは俺より多いだろうな。

english: My God, she's just a girl. What kind of fucking monsters are these people?
japanese: なんてこと……このコ、ただの女の子じゃない。 こんなフザケたことしでかすのはどういうクズ野郎だってのよ。
思い出せねえ。
エリザベス・グリーンか？
私はあなたの母親。
ワケわかんねえ。
御覧なさい。

english: The time for waiting is over.
japanese: 待つのはもう終わりです。

english: We've been compromised. Mercer knows you're on the payroll. We're evacuating.
japanese: 情報が漏れていたようです。 マーサーはあなたがこちら側の人間だと気付いている。 今すぐここから待避しましょう。
なんですって？

english: You know what he can do. Oh, Goddamnit. He'll kill me.
japanese: 彼がどんな能力を持っているか知ってる？ 私を殺しに来たんだわ……。

english: Oh, my God. Oh, my God, he's here.
japanese: 何てこと……。 もうここにいるのよ。
もうこのビルの中にいるんだわ。
分かってるさ。
奴らはどこに乗り込んだんだ？

english: Southeast Manhattan. But the Carrier -- the U.S.S. Reagan -- is supposed to remain off the southern coast....
japanese: マンハッタンの東南東。 でも、空母U.S.S.レーガンは南海岸にはいないはずよ。

english: I wonder where those trucks are heading.
japanese: あのトラックの群れ、どこに向かってるんだろ。

english: Wherever they're going, I'll bet McMullen is there. He did this to me and I'm gonna find out why.
japanese: やつらが何処へ向かおうと、マクマレンはあそこにいるはずだ。 俺をこんな風にしたヤツだからな、その理由を聞き出してやる。
それから？

english: Then I'm going to make sure he never does it to anyone else, ever again.
japanese: これ以上、ヤツにこんなことをさせないようにする。 二度とだ。

english: ... at the GENTEK building in mid-town Manhattan. What was initially thought to be a chemical spill was actually a biological attack on the city. Authorities have named Dr. Alex Mercer as the chief suspect...
japanese: ……マンハッタン中央部のジェンテックビルです。 当初化学物質の漏出だと思われていた事件は、市に対する生物化学兵器攻撃であることが判明しました。 当局はアレックス・マーサー博士を最重要容疑者として挙げており……。
いかがなさいますか？

english: At ease, Captain. Director McMullen, share your data with the Captain. Perhaps it will help him complete his mission.
japanese: 楽にして良いぞ、大尉。 マクマレン所長、貴方の情報を大尉にも説明してやってくれ。 彼の任務の助けとなるかもしれん。

english: Mercer...um...ZEUS...rebuilds on a cellular level -- a shape shifter.
japanese: マーサー……いや、ゼウスは、細胞レベルでの再構成を行っている ―― 異変種と言えよう。

english: We've used the DNA sample you recovered to synthesize a pathogen. Inside ZEUS, the pathogen will generate a possible cure.
japanese: 我々は君達が回収したDNAサンプルを利用してあるウイルスを合成した。 ゼウスの体内で、このウイルスは彼に“治療”をもたらすはずだ。
君の任務は何か分かるかね？

english: I am to inject the weapon into the target, ZEUS, and bring him in. Sir, with respect: all indications are that...
japanese: 私の任務はこの武器を目標、ゼウスに注入し“彼”を捕獲することです。 将軍、この件に関しましては……。

english: Mercer isn't a he, it's an IT.  I will debrief you when you complete your mission.
japanese: マーサーは“彼”ではない、“アレ”だ！。 君の報告は、任務が終わったときに聞かせてもらおう。
下がれ。

english: The Captain always did have difficulty seeing the bigger picture....
japanese: あの大尉は以前から大局を見渡す事ができんな……。

english: You think you've won, Mercer? You don't even know what fucking game you're playing.
japanese: 勝ったつもりか、マーサー？ お前は自分がどんな馬鹿げた遊びにつき合ってるのかも知らないだろう。

english: Well I can tell you all you need to know about Penn Station.
japanese: どうだ、俺はお前が知りたいことを全部知ってる、お前が知るべき全て、ペンシルバニア駅の全てをな。

english: In a way...I feel sorry for you.
japanese: ある意味では……お前には申し訳ないと思ってる。

english: ZEUS is down. Bring in the containment device.
japanese: ゼウスは無力化した。 格納用具を持ってきてくれ。

english: Man, you look like shit but...this might help.
japanese: うへえ、アンタ顔色悪いよ……でも、これ聞いたら元気出るんじゃない？
マクマレンか？

english: No, but they're watching someone for him. OK, it's this doctor named Bradley Ragland.
japanese: そうじゃないの。 でも奴ら、マクマレンの命令で誰かを見張ってんのよ。 こいつよ、この医者。 名前はブラッドリー・ラグランド。
こいつは何処にいるんだ

english: Whoa, whoa, whoa. He's a good guy. OK, you find him, he helps us get to McMullen.
japanese: まあまあまあ、この人“イイヒト”だよ。 まず彼を見つけて、そっからマクマレンを辿るの。

english: He's uptown at St. Paul's hospital. He runs the morgue there.
japanese: 彼はアップタウンのセントポール病院にいる。 そこで死体安置場をやってるんだってさ。

english: Wait, wait. Hold up. There's more.
japanese: 待って待って。 待ってったら。 まだあんのよ

english: Alright. So, I did some research on, uh, Hope, Idaho. It was an army town. On July 21st, 1969, it vanishes from the map....
japanese: いいかな。 その、ちょっと調べてみたんだよ。 えっと、アイダホ州のホープについて。 軍人の町だったみたい。 1969年7月21日に地図から消えてる。

english: The official word was that it was an anti-government gun-nut stand-off. Some militia killed a bunch of people, and the Feds killed the militia. Now, there was only one survivor.
japanese: 表向きの発表だと、反政府思想野郎の暴走だって。 何人かの民兵が大勢ぶっ殺して、連邦捜査官がそいつらを始末した。 結果、生存者は1名のみだそうよ。

english: Notice the girl, second from the left?
japanese: 左から2番目の女の子、分かる？
エリザベス・グリーンか。

english: Who looks an awful lot like a college student these days. Not bad for fifty-five years old.
japanese: 彼女、今見ても大学生にしか見えないよね。 とても55歳には見えない。
アイダホのホープは実験だったんだ。

english: How could you possibly know that?
japanese: どうやってあんたがそれを知ったの？

english: What the fuck are you talking about?
japanese: 何ワケわかんないこと言ってんの？

english: The people I've killed, they're in me. I can hear them -- see the thing's they've done.
japanese: 俺が殺した人間……彼らは全員俺の中に居る。 俺にはそいつらの声が聞こえてて ―― そいつらの経験が見えるんだ。

english: I can understand it all. I'm supposed to do these things. But it's right. I can feel it.
japanese: 俺にはわかるんだ、全部。 俺はこうしなきゃいけないんだ。 これでいいんだ。 俺にはそう思えるんだよ。

english: Find Ragland...and ask him about McMullen.
japanese: ラグランドを探して……マクマレンのこと、聞こうよ。

english: Odd structures in the parietal lobe, resembling parasitic infection.
japanese: 前頭葉に奇妙な構造体。 寄生性感染によるものと酷似している。
ラグランド博士だな。

english: Already said I won't deal with you people. My medical opinion's not for sale.
japanese: 生きた人間の相手はしないと言っているだろう。 私の医学的所見は売り物ではないんだ。
そりゃスゲーな。

english: What is it you want, exactly?
japanese: 君の要求は一体何だ？
ウイルスを止めるのに、あんたに協力してもらいたい。
何故だ？
“感染の兆候あり”と言えるだろう。
さあ、どっちに付く。

english: I’ll tell you what I know, but first we need to find where the military has patient zero.
japanese: 君に、私が知っていることを教えよう。 だが、まず始めに軍が第0号患者をどこに保管しているか知らなければ。
ああ、くそ
ラグランド、ラグランド！
俺に何が起きてんだ？

english: They know you carry the infection. They might be using you to produce an antivirus.
japanese: あいつらは君が感染してるってわかってるのさ。 たぶん君を使って抗体を作りたいんじゃないか。

english: If we learn what it's doing, maybe I can find a way to help your biology reject it.
japanese: そいつが何をしてるかを知ることができたら、そいつを君から取り除く方法がわかると思うね。
どうやって？
栄養の供給を断てばいいのさ。
俺に何が起きてんだ？

english: They know you carry the infection. They might be using you to produce an antivirus.
japanese: あいつらは君が感染してるってわかってるのさ。 たぶん君を使って抗体を作りたいんじゃないか。

english: If we learn what it's doing, maybe I can find a way to help your biology reject it.
japanese: そいつが何をしてるかを知ることができたら、そいつを君から取り除く方法がわかると思うね。
どうやって？
栄養の供給を断てばいいのさ。

english: So, um...what did Ragland have to say?
japanese: それで……ラグランドは何て言ってた？

english: Dana. I'm sorry. I didn't know how to tell you.
japanese: ディナ、すまん。 何と言ったらいいかわからなかった。

english: I need to know why. They made me this way and I need to understand.
japanese: なぜこうなったか知る必要があるんだ。 奴らが俺をこんなふうにして俺はそれを理解しないといけない。

english: It's alright, Alex. It's fine. Look, no matter what, you're still my brother.
japanese: いいの、アレックス。 大丈夫。 だって何が起きてもあんたは私の兄貴なんだから。
何？
待て、動くな！
ディナ！
何があったんだ？
ふむ……弱っているが大丈夫そうだ……。
しかし、他にも問題が起きたぞ……。
こんなものを……見つけたんだ。
それで、今度は何だ？

english: Looks like I've got plans. Do what you can for her.
japanese: 予定ができたみたいだ。 ディナを頼む。
マーサーだな。
誰だ？

english: Not important. What I know, you want to hear.
japanese: 気にするな。 俺の情報を聞きたいだろう？

english: Forty years ago, BLACKWATCH moved into Hope, Idaho, to begin Project RED LIGHT.
japanese: 40年前、ブラックウォッチはアイダホ州ホープに向かった。 レッドライト計画を始めるためにな。

english: They'd studied the virus for years on animals. They wanted to see what it would do to humans.
japanese: 何年間か動物実験を行ってウイルスについて研究してたのさ。 それで今度は人間で試したくなった。

english: At first, nothing happened. They let their guard down. Then it rose up suddenly, infected the town, overran the population. It found the perfect host in Elizabeth Greene.
japanese: 最初は何も起こらなかった。 だから奴らは警戒をゆるめた。 その時突然事件が起きた。 街は感染者であふれた。 エリザベス・グリーンという完璧な宿主を見つけてね。

english: GENTEK was working a sample of the Hope virus. They called it BLACKLIGHT. The goal was to engineer a version that could copy and combine genetic traits: to re-write living creatures.
japanese: ジェンテックはブラックライトと名付けてホープ・ウイルスを研究した。 遺伝形質の複製、結合ができるよう改良することが目的だった。 生物を書き換えるためにな。
覚えのある話だろう？

english: It should. You're not human. You're the BLACKLIGHT virus.
japanese: そのはずだ、お前は人間じゃない。 ブラックライトウイルスそのものだ。

english: But you're alive. BLACKWATCH is planning to deploy a weapon against you using aircraft....
japanese: でも君は生きてる。 ブラックウォッチは航空機を使って対抗する武器を展開させる気だ。

english: Get to the refueling station on top of the Highlines Building. You'll find what you need there.
japanese: ハイラインズビルの屋上にある燃料こまで行ってみろ。 そこに必要な物があるだろうさ。
戦車を狙え。

english: He's neutralized. You know the drill. I want this in a storage unit ten minutes ago. Bring in the Bird -- we're moving this to the Director. NOW!
japanese: 無力化したな。 訓練を覚えてるな。 10分でこいつを収容しろ。 そのあとでヘリに乗せて所長の所に連れていくぞ。 行け！
やぁ、ボス。

english: That is a foolish thing to do.
japanese: 馬鹿みたいだぞ。

english: You know who I am and you know what I do.
japanese: あんたは俺が誰なのかも俺が何をするのかも知ってるよな？

english: You were always so smart. You were ready to give up all our secrets.
japanese: 君はいつも賢明だった。 我々の秘密を暴ろしようとしていたんだ。
で、あんたが俺を感染させたのか？
何をまさか。 正気か？

english: But you always were a lateral thinker: plans within plans.
japanese: しかし君はいつも計画の上に計画を重ねる思索家だっただろう。

english: Put down the vial and back away!
japanese: そのびんを置いて下がれ！

english: Alex Mercer died. He died threatening to release the most deadly virus in history on the people of New York.
japanese: アレックス・マーサーは死んだ。 ニューヨークに史上最悪のウイルスをばら撒いてだ。

english: You died in Penn Station. But the virus found its way into your bloodstream.
japanese: 君はペンシルバニア駅で死んだ。 しかしウイルスは君に活路を見出した。

english: And here you are, filling in the blanks.
japanese: そして今君はここにいる。 空白を埋めるためにね。

english: We were trying to figure it out -- you just wanted to bring it all down.
japanese: 我々はなんとかして理解しようとしたが ―― 君は破壊したいのだろう。

english: But this isn't what you came here for, is it? You want to know what happened at Hope, Idaho. You want...the truth.
japanese: しかし君がここに来た理由とは違う、そうだろう？アイダホ州ホープで起こったことを知りたいはずだ。 そう……真実を。
そして……私はその秘密を知っている。

english: Listen, there's nothing else you can do to hurt me.
japanese: なぁ、俺をどうにかする手立てなんて無いぞ？
状況を報告しろ。

english: COLONEL TAGGART HAS ORDERED A GENERAL RETREAT!
japanese: タガート大佐が総員撤退の指示を出されました。

english: I GAVE NO SUCH COMMAND! GET ME A RA....
japanese: そんな命令出しておらん！ すぐにここに……。
乗ってください。

english: I'M MOVING BLACKWATCH COMMAND TO THE REAGAN AND TAKING HER OUT TO SEA! FIND TAGGART! BRING HIM TO ME!
japanese: ブラックウォッチ司令部はレーガンに移して海に出るぞ！タガートを探せ！俺のところまで連れてこい！
了解。

english: I CAN ONLY GIVE YOU FOUR HOURS! THEN -- IT'S OUT OF MY HANDS!
japanese: お前に4時間だけやる！ それを過ぎたら ―― 俺の手には負えん！
俺の名はアレックス・マーサー。

english: I'm the reason for all of this.
japanese: こんなことになった原因だ。

english: They call me a killer, a monster, a terrorist.
japanese: 奴らは俺をこう呼ぶ。 殺人鬼、化け物、テロリストと。
ぜんぶそのとおりだ。

english: Three weeks ago someone released a lethal virus in Penn Station.
japanese: 3週間前、何者かによって凶悪なウィルスがペンシルバニア駅にばら撒かれた。

english: I woke up in a morgue.
japanese: 俺は死体保管所で目覚めた。

english: Now I hunt, I kill, I consume, I become.
japanese: 今や俺は獲物を探し、殺し、食い尽くし、またそれに成りすますことだってできる。

english: I'm going to find out who did this to me.
japanese: 俺をこんな化け物に変えたやつを探し出す。

english: And I'm going to make them pay.
japanese: 落とし前をつけさせてやる。
ウォーカーだ！ 攻撃開始！

english: Ghost Three Nine to ground, do you have target in sight? Over.
japanese: ゴースト39より地上部隊へ、目標は視認できたか？ どうぞ。
異常なし。
止まれ！
動くな！
クリア。 行け！
お前、ついてこい。
こいつも殺れ。
君の指揮官はどこに？

english: Sir, he's in Times Square.  I'll call for trans...
japanese: サー、タイムズスクエアにおられます。 お呼びしま……
いいや。
必要ない。
助けて！ 助けてよ！
奴だ！

english: We have less than an hour. What's next?
japanese: あと1時間も無いな。 次はどうする？

english: The last person responsible for all of this dies tonight.
japanese: すべての元凶が今夜、死ぬ。

english: If we make it out of here. Do you think you're ready?
japanese: 辿り着けるかね……。 覚悟は出来てるか？
俺はこのために造られたのさ。

english: We have less than an hour. What's next?
japanese: もう1時間もないぞ。 どうする？

english: The last person responsible for all of this dies tonight.
japanese: 今までの事の責任を取らなきゃならない最後の1人が死ぬ。

english: If we make it out of here. Do you think you're ready?
japanese: ここから脱出できたとして、そんなことができると思うのか？
そのために俺がいるのさ。

english: Citadel Command this is Captain Cross.
japanese: Citadel司令部、こちらCross大尉。

english: Mission Accomplished. I have Colonel Taggart in custody. Ready for extraction.
japanese: 任務完了。 Taggart大佐を確保しました。 脱出します。

english: I looked for the truth. Found it. Didn't like it. Wish to hell I could forget it.
japanese: 俺は真実を探していた。 見つけたが、気に食わないものだった。 できることなら忘れたいぐらいだ。

english: Alex Mercer. This city suffered for his mistakes, for what he did at Penn Station. And whoever he was - that's a part of me.
japanese: アレックス・マーサー。 この街は彼の失敗で、ペンシルバニア駅で彼がやったことで苦しめられた。 そして彼が誰であったとしても今じゃ俺の一部だ……。

english: When I close my eyes I see the memories of a thousand dead men, screaming as I take their lives. Moments I'll relive forever.
japanese: 目を閉じれば何千もの死者の記憶が断末魔の悲鳴とともに浮かんでくる。 俺はこれと永遠に付き合っていくんだろう。

english: What have I become? Something less than human. But also something more.
japanese: 俺は何になったんだ？ 人間未満の何かで……だが人間以上の何かでもある。

english: Abandon ship. All crew, abandon ship.

japanese: ディナはどこだ？
彼女は私たちと共に。
お前は何なんだ？
理由。
何のだ！？
全ての。
痛いわ。
おい、おい！ ディナ！

english: Revenge was the only clear thought in my head.  The only one I could call mine.
japanese: 復讐だけが、俺の頭の中ではっきりしてる唯一の事柄だった。 それが俺の意思と呼べる、たったひとつのものだった。

english: I knew Gentek was the key.   It made sense.  I had worked there.  I had Dana investigating its operations. - And then there was Blackwatch.
japanese: 俺は、ジェンテックの仕業だと知っていた。 それは理解できた。 俺はそこで働いていたんだ。 俺はディナにその計画を調査させた。 そしてそこにはブラックウォッチがあった。

english: Whatever had changed me... erased my past…must have started there.
japanese: 俺を変えてしまった何もかもが…… 消えた俺の記憶も……そこから始まった。

english: I thought if I could find out who was running Gentek, before Blackwatch erased them too, I could find my past.
japanese: ブラックウォッチが消す前に、ジェンテックを動かしていたヤツを見つければ、記憶を取り戻せると思った。

english: What did you think that would gain you?
japanese: それでお前は何が得られると思っていたんだ？

english: Answers. I wanted to find out what happened to me.  The reason. Someone to blame.  Someone I could punish.
japanese: 答えさ。 俺の身に何が起きたのかを知りたかった。 その理由。 責めを負うべき誰か。 俺が裁くべき相手。

english: To tell you the truth I never thought I'd find her… I wished the hell I never had.
japanese: 正直なところ、彼女が見つかるなんて思ってなかった…… 地獄が待ち受けていないことを願っていた。

english: Did I tell you - Karen and I were together once.  Pictures of us at my apartment.   At least I assume that was us.
japanese: カレンと俺はつき合っていたと前に言ったな。 確かにアパートには俺たちの写真があり、少なくとも俺は写真に写っているのが俺たちだと思っていた。

english: Karen worked at Gentek…Maybe she could explain what was going on with me, and how to control it.
japanese: カレンはジェンテックで働いていた……。 多分彼女は説明できたはずだ、俺に何が起きたのか、そしてどうすればいいのか。

english: I know now...freeing Elizabeth Greene was a mistake.  She was a monster, infecting everything she touched.
japanese: 今ならわかる……。 エリザベス・グリーンを解放したのは間違いだった。 彼女は怪物で、彼女が触れたものは何であれ感染してしまう。

english: Get to Greene, find out who did this to me.  I thought that she was the key to all of this.
japanese: グリーンを見つけ、誰が俺にこんなことをしたのか突き止める。 俺は彼女がすべての鍵を握っていると思っていたんだ。
それで、彼女が原因だったのか？
ある意味ではな。

english: I knew we were connected.  Victims of a common enemy?  Subjects of a common experiment?  I didn't know.
japanese: 俺は彼女とは何か関係があるとなぜか分かっていた。 共通の敵の被害者だからか？ 同じ実験動物だからか？ それは分からない。

english: But I had Karen.  And we were going to put a stop to this thing together.
japanese: だが俺にはカレンがいる。 そして俺たちはこの状況を何とかするために動き出したんだ。

english: Everything was getting worse.  There were outbreaks across the city.  There were Hunters now, thanks to Greene. Blackwatch quarantined the island.
japanese: すべてが悪い方向に進んでいた。 感染は街中に広がり、グリーンのおかげでハンターが出るようになり、ブラックウォッチが島を封鎖した。

english: It became clear to me that McMullen - GENTEK's director of research - had linked us all together.
japanese: これら全てはマクマレン ―― ジェンテックの研究部長が裏で糸を引いているということは明らかとなっていた。

english: He worked for Blackwatch. He had studied Greene. Karen and I had worked for him - you know, before.
japanese: 彼はブラックウォッチのために働いていた。 彼はグリーンのことを研究していた。 カレンと俺も彼の下で働いていた。 知っているだろう、昔のことだ。

english: He knew who I was - and maybe - what had happened to me.
japanese: 奴は、俺が何なのか知っていた。 そしてもしかすると、俺に何が起きたのかも。

english: I thought: when I find McMullen I find myself.
japanese: 俺は、マクマレンを見つけた時こそ、俺自身を見つけることになると思っていた。

english: Well, what did he tell you?
japanese: それで、奴は何を教えてくれた？
マクマレンがか？ 色々だ。
いくつかは本音からの言葉だったな。
それで？
それで？ まあ、やつは死んだよ。

english: It was perfect.  They used Karen to get to me.  Used the genetic material I had collected to make a weapon to try and take me out.
japanese: 完璧にしてやられた。 奴らは俺にたどり着くためにカレンを利用していた。 俺が集めた遺伝子物質で俺を捕らえる武器を作ってたんだ。

english: By the time I discovered she was working for Blackwatch, she was gone.
japanese: カレンがブラックウォッチのために動いてることに俺が気づいた時、すでに彼女は消えていた。

english: But I had a bigger problem - a weaponized cancer was eating me from the inside out.
japanese: でも俺にはもっと大きな問題があった。 武器化された腫瘍が俺を内側から蝕んでいた。

english: I needed a doctor.  A special kind of doctor. I needed Ragland.
japanese: 医者が必要だった。 それも特別な奴だ。 ラグランドが必要だった。

english: How did it feel to be infected with something you couldn't control?
japanese: 自分で制御できない奴に侵食されるってのはどんな気分だったんだ？

english: Like my own body wanted me dead.
japanese: 自分の体が死にたがってるみたいだった。

english: Did you ever consider how the parasite felt? An intelligent cancer ripped from its host?
japanese: その寄生体のキモチってのを考えたことがあるか？ 知性のあるガンがその宿主から切り離されることを？

english: Yeah I did. Once… Right before I killed it
japanese: まあ、考えたさ。 一度…… そいつを殺す前にな。

english: I had no idea why Greene took my sister.  Revenge?  Bait for a trap?  All I knew was I had to get her back.
These Infected are like animals. But there’s something more - like a hidden hand, guiding them.
japanese: 感染者はまるで獣だ。 でもそれ以上に ―― 見えざる手が奴らを導いているようだった。

english: The hive mind became my only chance. It was a clue to find Dana and I thought by consuming infected minds, I could follow the link - and that would lead me to the one that took her.
japanese: 奴らの集団心理が唯一のチャンスだ。 ディナを見つける手がかりであり、あいつらを俺が吸収することで繋がりをたどって妹をさらった奴を見つけれると思ったんだ。

english: But then I realized...  I had the means... I had Blackwatch cornered.  I had their cancer weapon.
japanese: そこで俺は気がついた……。 いい方法があると……。 俺はブラックウォッチを追いつめていた。 あいつらの武器も持っていた。

english: I could put a stop to this right at the source if I could just get close enough to Greene.
japanese: グリーンに十分近づけさえすればこのイカれた状況を止められるってな。

english: So I find Dana, kill Greene, stop the madness. Seemed worth a shot.
japanese: ディナを見つけ、グリーンを殺し、恐慌を止める。 試してみる価値はあるはずだと思った。
その結果がこれか。

english: Oh yeah.  They're headless.  An infected army without a leader.
japanese: ああ。 奴らの頭はもういない。 リーダーはもういないんだ。

english: It's only a matter of time before they're wiped out.
japanese: 奴らが全滅するのも時間の問題だな。

english: And if there are other leaders out there?
japanese: 他にリーダーがいるってことはないのか？

english: No...they're all dead.  All dead.  Except me.
japanese: いや……全員死んださ。 全員だ。 俺以外のな。
俺は人間じゃない。

english: The revelation. It freed me. It killed me.
japanese: その事実が俺を自由にし、殺しもした。

english: I'm not human. Alex is just a role I play.
japanese: 俺は人じゃない。 「アレックス」ってのは俺が演じてるただの役割なんだ。

english: Part of me was relieved.   Part of me died.
japanese: そのことに半分ほっとしたし、抜け殻になった気もする。

english: Just another disguise, right?  So ingrained, so real even I believe it.
japanese: これも「擬態」だったんだ、そうだろ？ ずっと深く俺にしみ込んでいてそれが本当だと信じ切ってさえいたんだ。

english: I realized then, I was a part of it all; an offshoot of the virus that struck Hope in '69.
japanese: そして俺が69年にホープを襲ったウイルスの派生形なんだと気付いたんだ。

english: Blacklight. But there was a secret buried even deeper.
japanese: ブラックライト。 でもまだ深く埋もれている秘密もあった。

english: When you contacted me, I had no other option. You were an insider. I was sure you could give me the answer.
japanese: あんたが俺に接触してきたとき、俺には何の選択肢も無かった。 お前は内部の人間だったから俺はあんたが答えをくれると思ったんだ。
秘密というのは何だった？

english: Penn Station was ground zero, not Elizabeth Greene.  Whoever triggered the infection… whoever did this to me…
japanese: ペンシルバニア駅が事の発端だった、エリザベス・グリーンでなくな。 誰が感染を引き起こしたにせよ…… 誰が俺をこんな風にしたにせよ……。

english: I knew you could give me McMullen, and that McMullen would know.
japanese: あんたがマクマレンを引き渡すと知っていた。 そしてマクマレンもその事を知ってただろうな。

english: Hope was a Blackwatch project.  The goal of the experiment was to create a viral weapon that could be used to target specific racial types.
japanese: ホープのことはブラックウォッチの計画だった。 ある特定の人種に対する生物兵器を作ることを目的としたな。

english: But Hope went wrong.  A mutated virus infected all of those people - drove them mad.
japanese: しかしホープは失敗に終わった。 突然変異したウイルスは全員に感染し、彼らの気を狂わせた。

english: Their bodies crawled with hell.  And at the centre of it all was Elizabeth Greene.
japanese: 死体は惨いものだったよ。 そしてその中心にたった一人、エリザベス・グリーンがいた。

english: Somehow she had survived, endured the virus, absorbed it, changed it, whatever.
japanese: どうやったのか彼女は生き延びた。ウイルスに耐え、吸収し、変異させたのか……。

english: Her unique biology inspired this new bioweapons research program.
japanese: 彼女の特異な生体がこの新しい生物兵器の研究へとつながったのさ。

english: This became GENTEK -- and Alex Mercer worked for them.
japanese: そしてそれがジェネンテックとなり ―― アレックス・マーサーはそこで働いていた。

english: There was one leak too many and Randall stepped in to shut it down.   No one was safe.  Mercer fled the scene with a sample of the virus.  Took it as insurance if he needed it.
japanese: ある日ひどいウイルス漏れが起きて、ランドールが閉鎖するために首を突っ込んできた。 誰一人として感染していない奴はいない。 そしてマーサーはウイルスのサンプルを持って逃げだした。 万が一に備えた保険としてウイルスを持ちだしたんだ。

english: Blackwatch cornered him at Penn Station.  With his back to the wall, he unleashed the virus on Manhattan.
japanese: ブラックウォッチがペンシルバニア駅に追い詰めたが、逃げ場を失った彼はウイルスを地面に叩きつけてマンハッタンへと解き放った。

english: What Mercer did is beyond forgiveness.
japanese: マーサーのしたことは許されることじゃない。

english: But there is no Alex Mercer any more. The virus didn’t just kill him, it became him; copied his body down to the genetic level. It became me.
japanese: でももうアレックス・マーサーはいない。ウイルスは彼を殺さず、成りすました。 遺伝子レベルで彼の体をコピーしたのさ。 それが俺だ。

english: I AM THE VIRUS.   And I, in turn, released Elizabeth Greene - to infect the city a second time.
japanese: 俺はウイルスそのものだ。 そして俺はエリザベス・グリーンを解放することで街を2度目の感染へと陥らせてしまった。

english: Now she's dead, but Randall won't accept that the virus can be stopped. With FIREBREAK he'll level the city - just like Hope.
japanese: もう彼女は死んでるがランドールはウイルスが止まったとは思っていない。 奴は核攻撃でN.Y.をホープのようにしようとしている。

english: But now Hope has one final riddle to give up.  Greene was pregnant when they found her in '69. What happened to that child?
japanese: しかし今でもホープには不可解な点がある。 69年にグリーンを発見した時彼女は妊娠していたはずだ。 その子供はどうなった？

english: Do you suppose your answer is out there on the Reagan?
japanese: その答えがレーガンで得られると思うか？

english: All I know is: I'll get my answer from Randall.
japanese: 俺に分かるのは……ランドールから聞き出すしかないってことだ。
マーサーは？

english: The subject is wanted in connection with treasonous activities against the United States and her allies. As of last night, Alex Mercer is the number one terrorist threat in the United States.
japanese: アメリカとその同盟国に対する反逆に関わっていると指名手配されています。 昨晩にはアレックス・マーサーは我が国における第一位のテロリストになりました。

english: The target exhibits a classic low-affect personality.
Psychopathic disregard for others, narcissistic world-view punctuated by self-obsessive disorders.
japanese: 目標は典型的な無感動のようです。 自己強迫観念による他人への無関心さ、ナルシスト的な世界観が端々に見られます。

english: Ok, now how 'bout someone repeat that in English.
japanese: よし、誰か今のを英語で言い直してくれ。

english: Subject escaped at 22:30 hours after murdering three personnel.
Shortly thereafter, it is believed it kidnapped an operative.
It is infected with a variant of the BLACKLIGHT virus. Specifically DX-1118, a substance whose effects on the human body are poorly understood at best. We have no clue what it is capable of.
Doctor, try to keep the discussion high level. We need to know what we’re dealing with on the ground.
japanese: 博士、概要説明を続けてくれ。 我々は現場での対処方法を知る必要がある。

english: Its effect is...variable. When it DOES manifest, it makes the Idaho strain look like the common cold.
japanese: その影響は……一概には言えません。 発症した場合は、あのアイダホ菌を生成します。 普通の風邪によく似た症状を起こす菌です。

english: I don’t need to remind you gentlemen how close we came to the point-of-no-return in Idaho.
japanese: 我々がかつてアイダホで、引き返せない状況にどれだけ差し迫っていたかはご存知のはずでしょう？

english: Mercer’s body is a bomb, filled with this weaponized pathogen, waiting to go off.
japanese: マーサーの体は、兵器化されたウィルスを詰め込んで起爆を待つ爆弾のようなものなのです。

english: And now it’s loose in the city. Bring it in, no matter what it takes. I’d say dead or alive, but I’m not sure those classifications fit Alex Mercer any longer.
japanese: それが現在、街中に野放しになっているんです。 どんな犠牲を払ってでも、回収してください。 生死は問いません……と言いたいところですが、生死という表現がもはやアレックス・マーサーに当てはまるのかわかりません。

english: What is it we’re looking at here?
japanese: 我々がここで見ているものは何だ？
未来だ。

english: As amazing as it seems, he can manipulate his body on the genetic level.
japanese: 驚くべきことに、彼は遺伝子レベルで自分の体を変えられるようだ。

english: The changes are instantaneous. Everything, even the clothing is imitated.
japanese: それも一瞬で。 あらゆる物、服でさえ真似できるようだな。
必要な時に細胞の分化と変形ができる……。

english: I want it on a slab, I need to know what makes it tick.
japanese: ぜひとも解剖して何がそれを可能にしているか知りたいね。

english: McMullen, just what the hell is this thing?
Captain, we don’t know enough to say. Whatever Mercer is, he’s more like Greene than not.
But why are they here? What purpose do they serve?
All I know is that if the virus achieves control, we won’t be around to see the outcome.
But you weren’t paying attention. Watch it again. He uses the code to open the door right after consuming the target. That code was only known to three people.
What if ZEUS is collecting minds like a child collects moths?
What if he has access to everything anyone he consumes has seen, done or heard?
This would explain several things: its knowledge of BLACKWATCH tactics, its ability to pilot aircraft and armor, something Mercer had no training in.
As well as its uncanny skill in rooting out sleeper personnel.
This would also be very, very bad for all of us at BLACKWATCH.
Sir, I need your signature on these papers.
McMullen, you can see I’m busy. Stop talking about Mercer like he's the answer to our damn problems. He's a Runner.
That's where you're wrong -- no other Runner in BLACKLIGHT'S history has been male. The fact is, we don't know what he is.
I know what he's not.... That's enough.
Phone call, 12:21:04. Subjects RANDALL, PETER. MCMULLEN, RAYMOND. Topic: MERCER, ALEX J.
This, uh, risk. Mercer? What’s his status?
Yet, he’s under twenty-four hour watch.
And he still has access to Greene?
For now, yes. His work has been fundamental in unlocking the BLACKLIGHT virus.
You keep him on a tight leash. You know what's at stake here.
Listen. You need to get out of there.
japanese: 聞いてくれ。 今すぐそこから逃げるんだ。

english: We’ve got Mercer on vox. Tracing.
japanese: マーサーの音声を見つけました。追跡します。

english: I don’t care what they’re saying.
japanese: あいつらの言うことなんて気にしない。

english: We've got him. 30th and 7th, moving. On his cell. Send in the squad. Plainclothes.
japanese: 発見しました。30番と7番、追跡中。 携帯での通話。 部隊を送り込みます。 私服で行ってください。

english: You have no idea what they're planning.
Listen -- they won't risk it. Even McMullen isn't that stupid. I've got them in check.
Yeah. Problem is, they always struck me more as checkers players, Alex.
Sir, I have a priority intercept.
japanese: 重要な傍受に成功しました。
俺はいくつか証拠を持ちだしている。

english: You didn’t take it out of the lab did you?
japanese: そんな、研究所の外に持ちだしたなんて嘘でしょ？

english: Yeah. I have it here, on me. Wait. Wait. Fuck. I've gotta go.
japanese: いや、持ってる。 待て、待て、くそっ。 切るぞ。

english: What I'm saying is that the subject entered the station with the intent on releasing the weapon.
japanese: 自分が言いたいことは目標はウイルスを解き放つつもりで駅に入って行ったということです。
それは本当か？

english: Yes, sir. I have no doubt.
japanese: はい、本当です。
どのくらいの人数がさらされた？

english: In the station, sir? I don't know. Hundreds. Thousands. I don't know....
japanese: 駅にですか？ わかりません。数百、数千……わかりません。

english: Mercer, Alexander J. Parents divorced. One sibling. Doctorate Genetics, Columbia University. Hired Gentek Special Projects.
japanese: マーサー、アレクサンダーJ。 両親は離婚。 兄妹が1人。 遺伝学博士号をコロンビア大学で修得。 ジェネンテック特殊企画部に就職。

english: Associate Director: Department Classified. Level A access. Reported to: Director McMullen, Raymond.
japanese: 副所長：所属課は機密。 Aクラスのアクセス権を持つ。 以上がマクマレン、レイモンド所長への報告。

english: Current Status: Assigned CODENAME ZEUS. Priority One A target RESPONSIBLE FOR THE RELEASE OF THE BLACKLIGHT VIRUS IN NEW YORK. DO NOT APPROACH.
japanese: 現状：コードネーム・ゼウスと名づける。 第1A優先目標。 ニューヨークにブラックライトウイルスを撒いた張本人である。 接触厳禁。

english: Sir, we're reestablished contact with the target.
Is this Alex? End this. Come in. Now.
Why didn't you tell me where this sample came from!?
I couldn't, Alex. I couldn't risk it.
She wasn't infected naturally. She was a damn test-subject!
japanese: 彼女は自然に感染したんじゃない。 実験台だったんだ！
それは知らなかった。

english: This whole thing stinks. We're being set up. The results we've achieved, where do they go? They just... vanish.
japanese: もう全て怪しいな。 俺たちは得意になってた。 俺らの研究成果はどこに消えたんだ？ ……消えやがった。

english: Hm, what are you going to do?
japanese: これからどうする？
何であれ行動を起こさないと。

english: 11:10:01. Subjects: MERCER, ALEX J. and PARKER, KAREN I.
If I'm going down, I'm not going alone.
Alex, listen, we can work this out.
What do you want, Alex? What can I do?
I want the truth! Where did she come from!?
You were in special projects? What were you working on?
japanese: あなたは特殊企画部にいたんですよね？ 一体何について研究をしていたんですか？

english: We didn't know what we were working on. I mean, I pieced it together, finally. But by then, I was hooked.
japanese: 何の研究かは知らされていなかった。 最終的には何とか全貌を掴んだがその時には俺は虜になっていた。

english: It was beautiful. It kept changing. It was the single most complicated viral structure I had ever seen.
japanese: あれは美しい。 常に変化する。 今まで見てきた中で最も複雑なウイルス構造体だった。

english: All in all, I made good time. It only took me three years to make it more dangerous by a factor of ten.
japanese: 何から何まで楽しかったよ。 3年間の研究でその危険性を10倍にまで高めることができた。

english: Morality wasn't my job. Modifying chimeric viruses was. I wasn't in field applications, I was in engineering.
japanese: 倫理なんてものを考えるのは俺の仕事じゃなかった。 非現実なウイルスを変えてくのが仕事でね。 応用するのではなく加工していたんだ。

english: Here's what's known: the subject can shift its body structure to an unknown degree.
It can fashion portions of its body into a weapon, change its facial features and perhaps even imitate voices and mannerisms.
Long and short: it's a security nightmare.
ZEUS’ memory problem might be an advantage we can use.
japanese: ゼウスの記憶の問題は、我々が利用できる利点かもしれない。

english: Familiar people, objects, places.... These seem to restore memories to ZEUS. This restoration is painful.
japanese: 親しい人や物や場所……。 これらはゼウスに記憶を戻させるようだ。 この回復は苦痛を伴う。
それはゼウスを傷つけることができるのか？

english: During these moments, ZEUS is vulnerable. The more we know about it, and the less it can discover, the better off we are.
japanese: これらの瞬間、ゼウスは脆弱になる。 我々がより少ないものについて、それが発見することができるということを知っているほど、我々はより良くなる。

english: We can also get creative. We can lie.
japanese: 我々は創造的になることもできる。 我々は嘘もつける。

english: What do you think goes on in her head?
japanese: 彼女何を考えてるんだと思う？

english: Nothing, her brain was fried by the virus.
japanese: 何も。 彼女の脳はウィルスで焼けてるよ
ふむ……まるで……。
ああ。

english: It seems like she's...waiting for something.
japanese: まるで……何かを待ってるみたいだな。

english: What the hell happened in there?
japanese: ここで何が起きたんだ？

english: Team One dropped comm just after they entered the holding cell area.
japanese: チーム1が独房に突入した途端連絡がありません。

english: That's it, close it off. No one goes in or comes out of the Gentek Building. I want it sealed with Level Four protocols.
japanese: なら、閉鎖しろ。 誰もジェンテックビルに出入りさせるな。 警戒レベルは4にしろ。

english: Look, the last Runner took three weeks to track down. It hit a podunk burg called Two Bluff, Arizona. No one noticed when the town dried up and blew away.
They're clever. The worker-bees -- the Walkers -- they just do as they're told, the Runners are different. They think.
Her? Hm...she's a Runner. With nowhere to run.
It represents the most intriguing human carrier ever discovered to date. Its body produces hundreds of unique strains on a daily basis. Most are harmless, a few are deadly.
It's like it's evolving at a rapid pace. It's war-dialing at a genetic level. It's becoming something else.
You’ve seen our order to isolate the subject on site, sir. From General Randall himself.
japanese: 被験体を現場で隔離せよとの命令を受けられたのでは？ ランドール将軍から直々に。

english: She’s more than some test subject! You have no idea what she represents!
japanese: 彼女は一介の被験体なんかではない！ 貴様は彼女が何なのかわかっていないのだ！

english: Don't try and run this like some exercise. We need to move her out of the city, now!
japanese: 簡単に隔離できると思っているのか！ 彼女を街の外に出さねばならん、今すぐにだ！

english: What were we keeping from them? Everything.
japanese: 俺たちが隔離しているもの？ 全てだ。
続けてください。

english: This...source. It’s the key to genetics -- but it’s also a machine, churning out the worst viruses ever seen.
japanese: これが始まりだ……遺伝子の謎を解くカギだが ―― 今までに見たこともないような最悪なウイルスをばらまく機械でもある。

english: Things that -- if they got out of the lab -- could literally erase human civilization as we know it.
japanese: もしこれが研究所から外に出たら ―― 文字通り我々の文明を消すだろうな。

english: And how did that make you feel?
japanese: それで、そのことについてどう思いますか？
……俺は感じる必要がなかったんでね。

english: The process is this: we remove a small amount of blood from the subject. Her blood is always teeming with variants of the virus.
These samples are the key to our research. They could cure every ailment known to man.
Give me a report on the physical state of Codename MOTHER.
The subject has been incarcerated for thirty-nine years without ill-effect.
Through this period it has exhibited no degenerative effects -- no joint-decay, swelling, discomfort or atrophy. Nothing.
It is quite literally, un-aging. We have no idea how this is possible.
I don't know. We don't have all the data. Greene seems to be the focus. The others nothing more than puppets.
Sir, there's no scientific backing to support that.
Look. The centralized control is directed by the focus. It spreads, it thinks, it plans. 40 years of science says it can't be so, but tell me that isn't happening.
A strike against the central carrier can decapitate the infection. I feel that in my gut. I don't need science to know that.
Codename: MOTHER exhibits odd characteristics not consistent with DX-1118 infection. Whether this represents a natural immunity -- or something more -- remains to be seen.
japanese: コードネーム: マザーはDX-118とは異なる奇妙な性質を示しています。 これは自然免疫によるものなのか ―― それともそれ以外のものなのか ―― 未だ不明です。

english: So, what does this mean to our research?
japanese: それで、これは我々の研究にとってどういった意味がある？

english: We all agree, she represents the best chance we have to crack the virus' defenses.
japanese: 彼女は我々がウィルスを殺せる最高のとっかかりを示しているんですよ！ これに関しては私たち全員が同意見です。

english: I believe Greene is some sort of trigger. Imagine life on earth as a single organism. The disease she releases could be something like a hormone in the body, causing change. Shifting the organism.
In this case, shifting life on earth?
Subject: Greene, Elizabeth M. Codenamed MOTHER. Recovered at Hope, Idaho, 7/7/69. Operation ALTRUISTIC.
Transferred to Ft. Detrick on 8/1/69 for containment.
Held at Detrick, Ward F, for nine years, two months.
10/1/78 -- transferred to containment at Governor’s Island Medical Station, New York.
Moved to Gentek midtown facility, 1/1/89, for study in Project BLACKLIGHT.
BLACKWATCH is lying. Something besides Elizabeth Greene came out of Hope.
Her hip bones indicated a pregnancy.
There's no record of pregnancy on her charts. Who would have the power to conceal that?
Sir, off the record, who the hell are these BLACKWATCH guys?
All you need to know is you'll be taking your cues from them.
I'm a Marine, sir. I'll do whatever is required, but off the record, what the hell are we dealing with here?
There's two types of wars America doesn't want to find itself in, Major. One is nuclear and the other is the one we're fighting here and now.

japanese: 出撃すれば殺す。

english: NO ONE IS SAFE. NOTHING IS SACRED. WE ARE BLACKWATCH. WE ARE THE LAST LINE OF DEFENSE.
japanese: 安全な者は無く、神聖な物も無い。 我々はBlackWatchである。 我々は最後の防衛線であり、

english: WE WILL BURN OUR OWN TO HOLD THE REDLINE. IT IS THE LAST LINE TO EVER HOLD.
japanese: これが維持されるべき最後のラインなのだ。

english: Stow that shit Corporal, get her in the vehicle. You! Rendezvous at 22:00 at Bryant Park!
japanese: 伍長、速度を落として彼女を車に乗せろ！ ブライアント公園に2:00集合だ！
了解です！

english: Keep your eyes open. There's a Runner on the loose.
japanese: 注意しろ！ ランナーがまだ野放しなんだぞ！
行け、行け！
将軍からの第一の命令は！

english: When in doubt, shoot to kill!
japanese: 疑わしい時は殺せ！
第二に！
退路はなく、完全に封鎖せよ！
第三！
レッドラインは突破されず、です！
放せこのクソナチ野郎！ くそったれ！

english: *laughs* You kiss your mother with that mouth?
japanese: お前その口でママにキスするのか？

english: *into headset* Roger, 2215 Christopher street. Apartment 15 A. Got it. Saddle up, you've got a CP. Move it!
japanese: 了解、クリストファー通り2215番地のアパート15A。 確認した。 急行する。 急げ、CPを手に入れた。

english: The subject is exhibiting symptoms of primary infection.
We have confirmation from sniffer stations up and down the island. The strain it is carrying is an unknown.
What kind of spread are we talking about here?
Thankfully it seems incapable of crossing water bodies. We've sealed the island's exits. It can be fought here.
We have confirmation of the agent in two sampling stations.
japanese: 我々は2ヶ所のサンプリング・ステーションの職員から確認を取った。

english: That is...a variant of DX-1118. Still un-typed.
japanese: これは……DX-1118の変種です。まだ分類されていませんが。

english: In ten to fifteen hours, an outbreak is likely to appear. It is vital that fast-action teams are on site within minutes of the first confirmation.
japanese: 10～15時間のうちに感染爆発が起こる可能性が高い。 確認が取れ次第すぐに高速対応部隊を送り込むのが重要だ。

english: We’re here to make certain what happened in 1969 never happens again. You all know your duty. Whatever it takes.
japanese: 1969年に起きたことを2度と起こさないために我々がここにいる。全員自分の義務が分かっているな？ 犠牲を恐れるな。

english: Colonel Taggart has issued a lockdown order on the island. This comes down from on high -- the old man is here, calling the shots personally.
I need men with ice water in their veins. Nothing crosses the Redline.
Nothing gets on or off the island without permission from BLACKWATCH Command.
Gentlemen. We've prepared for this moment for forty years. We will not fail.
I want a curtain of men and armor up the moment the call comes in.
Over-flights on the rivers are ready to pick off civs trying to cross. The bridges are wired and blocked by armor.
Once we're primed, nothing unsanctioned gets on or off the island.

japanese: Six One、報告を！

english: Under heavy assault, Ten One. Lost 30-40% of the defensive force at the stadium.
japanese: 強烈な反撃を喰らってます、Ten One。30～40％程の損害です。
維持しろ！
了解！

english: Radio Command. Tell them the stadium's been compromised.
japanese: 無線命令。スタジアムがやばいと伝えてくれ。

english: Sir. The Wisemen team is present and ready for the hunt.
Sir...is it true he caught the last Runner on his own?
Sir, we've got the U.S.S. Reagan on the comm.
This is Palace Command. What's your status Citadel?
This is Citadel Command. All hands report stations ready. Jets fueled and ready for over-flight of Control Zone.
Barges will be moved in as temporary storage for the dead.
Strict security is to be kept on these piers. These are strict no access areas for anyone outside the group.
When a barge is full, the contents will be incinerated. If this disease runs its full course, you can expect more than four thousand barges.
Sir. How much longer do we have to put up with these amateurs?
Since your brain can't fathom why the Marines are here, I'll lay it bare.
The old man brought them in for two reasons: they're the shock troops, they move in, take the losses, point out the enemy and we do the cleanup.
Second, they're the public face of this occupation. When the city's burned to the ground, they take the fall.
Sir, are we going to pull this one out of the fire?
I don’t give a shit if it’s Hope, Two Bluff, New York or fuckin’ DC. We burn out the infection until it’s done. Whatever the cost.
New York ain’t shit in the face of the other option. Just burn it, just fucking burn it. Burn it all until it’s clean.
So, I swing in behind the plane as it’s trying to limp across the Hudson.
And it's waggling its wings, like, don't shoot!. I had tone like a mile out.
Just give me rough projections on Marine casualties.
It’s likely the target is a Runner. The last we encountered dragged ass across the Southwest United States for weeks, infecting as she went.
Sir, what are our rules of engagement?
Immediately call in air support and artillery. If it attempts to relocate before the strike, shoot with the heaviest gear you have at hand. And if it’s still kicking after that...leave it to us.
It's behavior seems to be changing.
The virus is acting in a manner not consistent with previous outbreaks. We have no idea why.
I've stopped this damn thing before. Stopped it dead. I'll do it again. We've been preparing for this moment for forty years.
If it comes down to it, just do your job, son. Everything else is in God's hands.
This is classified BEYOND TOP SECRET. Project BLACKWATCH established 6/9/62 by DARPA and the Department of the Army.
Base of Operations Ft. Detrick, Maryland.
Mandate: Research and development of biological weaponry for use against foreign powers.
Following operation ALTRUISTIC on 7/7/69, BLACKWATCH’s mandate has changed.
It is now: detect, conceal and prevent outbreaks of unknown viruses -- both man-modified and natural -- on American soil.
BLACKWATCH operates in secret. Officially, they do not exist. Their task is thankless but necessary in this age of modern warfare.
You are now one of them.
We knew they were high up. Probably so high up, that to see the office of the President, you had to look down.
And what did they have you working on?
These viruses...would you classify them as biological weaponry?
It would be hard not to.
You’ll hear a lot of crap about where the group started, Lieutenant, but...I’ll give you the lay of the land.
japanese: 君は本隊創設の理由について色々とつまらんことを言われることになるだろう、大尉。 そうだな……知っておいてもらおうか。
はい。

english: Son, how do you fight a war?
japanese: 戦争とはどう戦うものだ？
はい？

english: You engage the enemy. In our case, the virus. We couldn’t just sit back and study it, we had to experience it. No one had seen anything like it in action before.
japanese: まず接敵する。 我々の場合ウイルスとだ。 それは机に向かうだけでどうこうできるものではない。 我々は体験せねばならなかったのだ。 そのようなものがことを起こしたところを見た者などいないのだからな。
アイダホのホープのことですか？

english: Hope, Idaho, was just a...sacrificial lamb. A necessary cruelty. Without it, we could not save the world.
japanese: アイダホ州ホープはただの……生贄の子羊だ。 必要な犠牲だった。 あれなしでは世界を救えなかっただろう。
わかりました。

english: Of course you do. That’s why you’re one of us
japanese: 当然だ。 だからこそ君は我々の一員なのだ。

english: The Army built a town. They told people it’s to test a self-sufficient base in case of a nuclear attack.
They filled the town with a cross-section of ethnicities. Army families from all over. They told them it was progressive.
They told them lots of things. And then something happened that was to test their faith.
Everyone except the research staff was exposed.
The effects -- which most thought would be severe -- never appeared.
No one could understand why, but the virus seemed to be inert in humans. Until the births.
They were wrong, but it took four years for them to realize it.
So you place a hundred families with just as many geographic backgrounds in one, isolated locale for one reason -- as a cross-section.
Maintained objectivity. It helps if the test subject does not know that he or she is taking part in a test.
They’d come in, just as happy as you please. Hell, they’d roll up their damn sleeves for you.
What were you injecting them with? And when was this?
That was...the summer of...um, 1963. Damned if I know what it was. All I know is, I didn't want it injected into me.
We told them we'd be introducing compounds into the town that simulated fallout -- that we wanted to track it in the population. Harmless stuff.
japanese: 彼らには核戦争を想定した宿舎だと説明した ―― 集団の中に取り入れてみたいのだと。 無害なものだと。
それが上っ面だったのか？

english: One of them. It made it easy to take samples and run tests. No one asked questions -- everyone was happy to help.
japanese: そうだった。 でもこの嘘がサンプルの収集とテストをしやすくしたんだ。 誰も疑問を持たなかった。 誰もが喜んで手伝ってくれたよ。

english: Injecting it into chimps -- this was CARNIVAL I, you understand. We got amazing results.
japanese: チンパンジーにそれを注射すること。 これはカーニバルIだった。 わかるだろう。 我々は驚くべき結果を得た。

english: Boosted intelligence, increased strength. We were all expecting something pretty dramatic in Hope right after we introduced CARNIVAL II.
japanese: 知能が増幅され、筋力も増えた。 我々は皆、カーニバルIIを注入した後、希望としてさらに劇的な変化が起こるをすると予想していた。
何かおこったのか？
いや ―― 何も。

english: In your best recollection, what was the most important discovery in CARNIVAL II?
Hm, between 1965 and 1968 twenty-seven births occurred in Hope, Idaho. All tested positive for something like DX-1118.
These children represented something not seen before. They were infected with the virus in the womb, but when they were born:
All births post 1965 ended in the death of the child from unforeseen genetic defects.
Before these deaths, each so-called Hope Child exhibited something exceptional.
The genetic disorders which claimed their lives were unique. It was almost like the virus was trying to achieve something, and failing.
Greene, Elizabeth A. had known associations with six of the twenty-seven Hope Children. It is unknown if this was the source of her exposure to the DX-1118 variant.
What is known is this, Greene’s infection coincides within two days of the death of the last Hope Child:
Allan, Michael K. DOD...um, 8/6/68. Aged two years, two months.
Hope, Idaho, was as good a test-bed as we’re ever going to get, without losing everything.
This new outbreak is not following the pathology of the virus: too many infections, too wide a spread, too many...surviving entities. Something’s different this time.
So, what are we looking at here?
A computer projection of the vector spread.
As you can see, fourteen days out, the model explodes. The spread is extremely wide -- far greater than the Hope outbreak ever achieved.
What we think we’re seeing is this: lower mortality rate and longer incubation period.
In short, we prepared for a war with the wrong enemy. This is something new.
We’ve never seen a pathogen with 99.9% mortality rates.
99.999%. It’s fast too. By day three, it had taken over 70% of the town.
The remaining citizens were then forcibly infected.
In the first month, half of the population died from the virus, but the illusion of an uninfected town remained intact.
Hope, Idaho, Operation CARNIVAL II. Began 6/11/64. Ended 7/7/69. Four hundred and sixty-one subjects infected with DX-1118 variant A.
japanese: アイダホ州ホープ、カーニバルII作戦。 64年6月11日開始、69年7月7日に終了。 461人へDX-1118 A型を感染させる。

english: Nine hundred and ninety-eight days of no reported infection. Outbreak occurred 8/8/68. Town recaptured 7/7/69. Operation ALTRUISTIC.
japanese: 98日間は感染の報告はなし。 しかし68年8月8日に爆発的に感染。 街が制圧されたのは69月7月7日。 ALTRUISTIC作戦による。

english: Examination of the infected individuals revealed a new strain of DX-1118 not seen before. This is thought to be the source of the Hope Outbreak.
Operation ALTRUISTIC. Begun 7/5/69. Elements of the First Biohazard Threat Unit, now called BLACKWATCH, out of Ft. Detrick.
japanese: ALTRUISTIC作戦。 69年7月5日開始。 第一号バイオハザード危機対応部隊、現在のブラックウォッチ隊による。 デトリック基地からの出動。

english: The force encountered resistance from infected individuals on the outskirts of Hope, Idaho. After a prolonged skirmish, the town was shelled. It was then recaptured.
japanese: アイダホ州ホープの郊外で感染者による攻撃を受ける。 小競り合いを繰り返した後に、町を砲撃、制圧した。

english: Two survivors. One: Greene, Elizabeth A. Aged nineteen years. Two: Male Child, Identity Classified beyond Top Secret.
japanese: 生存者は2名。1人目、グリーン、エリザベスA。 当時19歳。 2人目、男児。 身元は最高機密以上の極秘扱い。

english: Once insinuated into the system, it affects the protein encoding regions of the promoter introns within each cell.
In short, it enters, repurposes and changes the cell. The new cell replicates with formerly dormant non-coding regions active, causing drastic biological changes.
More often than not, these changes are TOO drastic. In 99.9% of the cases, the biology of the organism fails during this repurposing, causing massive organ failure and death.
From first infection to death varies per target, but is usually measured in days or hours.
Codename MOTHER and Codename PARIAH tested. MOTHER yielded fourteen variants of the DX-1118 virus.
PARIAH tested negative for all viral agents
Subjects were moved to separate secure facilities for extended study.
They represent our last chance of learning anything from Project CARNIVAL II.
Director McMullen pushed for the weaponization of the sample.
And who did he employ to perform this unauthorized research?
Sir, I have no idea. We had no access to the BLACKLIGHT lab. This place is a network of need-to-know silos.
Karen. Let me help you. We’re all in very deep here. There’s only one way out: cooperation.
If you assist us, you’re free and clear. A ticket anywhere you want and a top-level assignment. If you don’t... There’s nothing I can do for you.
Listen, Karen. Whatever he is now, he’s not the man you knew, he’s something else.
McMullen, Raymond F. DOB, 1/10/55. Doctorate Genetics, University of Pennsylvania 7/21/75. Founded Gentek 11/1/76.
After publication of a paper on Non-Coding Sequences in Junk DNA in 1989, was approached by BLACKWATCH to direct research into DX-1118 strain A.
For the past nineteen years, BLACKWATCH has been a silent partner in Gentek.
McMullen remains the preeminent expert on the nature of the BLACKLIGHT virus. Current Status: possible security risk. Targeted by Codename ZEUS.
Um. No need to...I...forgot something. *laughs* I need to grab it before they lock us out.
Wait here. *into microphone* Parker, Karen, Employee 2-18, attempting to enter into main labs.
Last I saw, he was running from the building.
I don’t know. His laptop. I think he was carrying his laptop.
I don’t know. I can’t tell you what I don’t know.
Parker, Karen I. DOB 1/1/76. Doctorate Genetics, Rutgers University 7/2/2003. Hired Gentek Special Projects 2/1/2002.
japanese: カレン・パーカー。 1976年1月1日誕生。 2003年2月7日、ラトガース大学にて遺伝学博士号取得。 2002年2月1日、ジェンテック特別計画へ参加。

english: Director: Genotyping. Level D access. Reported to: Director McMullen, Raymond F. Romantically involved with Mercer Alex J. Wanted for questioning.
japanese: ディレクター：遺伝子検査の主任科学者。 レベルDアクセス権保有。 レイモンド・F・マクマレン所長の報告によれば、捜索中のアレックス・マーサーと親密だったようだ。

english: Subject has to be detained and transferred to base Six Charlie Alpha One.
japanese: 目標を拘束し、6CA1基地に移送する必要がある。

english: On my authority, allow two of the Penn Station bodies to be handed over to...do you have a pen?
St. Paul’s Hospital. The pathologist’s name is Dr. Ragland.
Director McMullen, you understand I need to report this.
Subjects: MCMULLEN, RAYMOND and RAGLAND, BRADLEY. Time 09:09:22.
Bradley...the corpses from Penn Station are infected with BLACKLIGHT.
I warned you about bringing it into the city, Raymond.
Take appropriate precautions and remember: you’re as culpable as us. We’ll be watching.
Ragland, Bradley T. DOB, uh...2/21/60. M.D. Johns Hopkins 11/1/86.
Hired Gentek Special Projects 9/9/87. Left Gentek 12/1/92 after refusing to work on BLACKLIGHT.
Currently employed: City of New York, Pathologist, St. Paul’s. Under surveillance since 1992.
Current Status: Considered a Low Priority risk. Potential asset, with the correct leverage.
This weapon is to be given the highest priority. I want it in the field -- yesterday!
We’re producing it as fast as we can. The Harlem facility's getting up to speed as we speak.
Good. We may have just caught a break. Dismissed!
Ho, what the hell is this shit? Looks like paprika, stinks like ass.
Stow it and get those tanks loaded on the chopper. Whatever it is, you better get used to it, they’re spraying it over the city -- and us.
You could eat this stuff and it wouldn’t do a thing.
How the hell are they going to field this stuff?
When the material is introduced, even at less than ten parts per million, it hampers the normal biological processes of any infected subject.
How much of this stuff can we get?
Once the plant is fully online, the question is: how much do you want?
This substance. What will its effect be on ZEUS?
japanese: こいつについてだが、これはゼウスにどういう影響を及ぼすんだ？

english: Mercer is different from the average infected, but he does share a similar biology. In my opinion, it will affect him much like it does those tainted with the BLACKLIGHT virus.
japanese: マーサーは一般的な感染者とは違いますが、似たような生態ではあります。 私見ですが、ブラックライトウイルス感染者と同様の効果を彼にも与えれると思いますよ。
殺せるのか？
すぐにわかるでしょう。

english: Substance A-113A -- which we call Bloodtox, due to its odd coloration -- is a poison which only affects the BLACKLIGHT virus.
japanese: A-113A、その色合いからブラッドトックスと呼んでいるものは、ブラックライトウイルスにだけ反応する毒です。
副作用は？

english: It shouldn’t affect humans at all.
japanese: 人間には効かないはずです。

english: What’s the word on the new round of test subjects?
Sir, they’re testing off the charts. No ill effects at present. No evidence of the un-modified virus!
Prep them for field deployment -- ASAP.
Sir, I-I don’t think we’re ready.
This variant they’ve injected into the D-Codes -- it’s three weeks old! We shouldn’t be putting it out in the field.
At this point, I don’t think it’ll make much of a difference.
What kind of situations are these...things suited for?
japanese: こいつらはどんな任務に向いてるんだ？

english: They’ve been trained to specifically counteract viral-targets. They are highly-mobile, super strong, resilient and capable of going toe-to-toe with even the strongest infected.
japanese: 彼らはウイルスに汚染されている敵でも対抗できるよう特別な訓練を受けています。 高い機動力・パワー・回復力を備え、強力な感染者とでも1対1で戦えます。
近接戦闘もか？

english: It’s what they were made for, sir.
japanese: そのために作られたんです。

english: Due to the nature of the virus, extensive surgical modification -- not possible on other personnel -- was performed on the D-CODES.
Bulletproof steel inserts were placed beneath the skin in all major soft-tissue areas. The healing capacity of the virus makes such enhancements not only advantageous, but extremely efficient.
Listen up. You're the first of our group to go into the field and confront the virus directly on its own terms.
japanese: 聞け。 お前が我々の中で最も早く実戦に行きウィルスと直面する。
命令はなんでしょう？

english: The old man wants Mercer’s head on a platter. Doesn’t care how. You’ll be priority on Strike Package Intel.
japanese: あの老いぼれはマーサーを狙ってる。 方法は問わん。 お前を攻撃支援要請時の第一出撃隊に配置する。

english: Report on Project D-CODE. Virus variant DX-1120 injected into one-hundred and sixty-one test subjects. No fatalities.
japanese: Dコード計画に関するレポート。 ウイルス変種DX-1120を161名の被検体に注入。 死亡者なし。

english: Virus replication and re-growth of the organism completed in less than two days.
japanese: 2日と経たないうちにウイルスの複製、生体組織の再増殖が終わる。

english: Subjects show increased metabolic rate, dramatic strength and reaction increases. No side effects manifested to date.
japanese: 対象は代謝速度の上昇、劇的な筋力と反射神経の向上を示す。 現段階で副作用は見られない。

english: Getting the sample is just the first step.
What do you think you guys can cook up?
Hm, I have a few ideas, but I think we could do cancer.
It grows, it replicates. Potentially, with a sample we could engineer something that will throw it off it’s game - make it destroy itself.
McMullen is missing the point -- he has no idea what this...life form can do.
The Parasite he’s created could be worse than Mercer himself! You can’t just...go play God and hope it’ll all work out!
And what if this...parasite gets out of Mercer? What then?
We’re supposed to be stopping these things, not manufacturing new ones!
What the hell else did they pull out of that place? I mean, she’s bad enough, but what else is there?
Um.... No one talks about that. If you don’t want to end up in a lime pit, I’d shut up. Right now.
ALTRUISTIC recovered several interesting anomalies from Hope. We’ve only let you see some.
I’m gonna forget you know what that is, doctor. You don’t have clearance. Always remember: YOU work for US. Escort the Director out....
Sir! If you’ll just follow me, Dr. McMullen.
While MOTHER represents what we think is a simple carrier -- something we’ve seen time and again -- PARIAH is unique.
There are several intriguing anomalies: for one, the subject is male. Secondly, it exhibits no evidence of carrying any virus. However....
However, we’re not at all certain what it is.
Subject PARIAH removed to clean room at Vandenburg Air Force Base on 8/1/69 as main test subject in Project CRUSADE.
japanese: パリアはヴァンデンバーグ空軍基地のクリーンルームへ69年8月1日に移送。 クルセード計画の主研究対象として。

english: Subject exhibits unusual biological activity. Responsible for five deaths in thirty-four years of captivity.
japanese: 対象は特異な生体活動を示している。34年間にわたる監禁中5件の死亡事故に関連。

english: Unlike MOTHER, PARIAH exhibits no physical symptoms of BLACKLIGHT infection.
japanese: マザーと違いパリアはブラックライト感染による身体的兆候はない。
意味がわかりません！

english: PARIAH may be the only thing that can stop Mercer and Greene. They may not let me know what he is, but I can guess.
japanese: パリアだけがマーサーとグリーンを食い止めれるかもしれません。 彼が一体何なのかを彼らは教えてくれませんが、想像はできます。

english: If Greene was an imperfect release of non-coding regions of the genome, and Mercer was something more, what if PARIAH was a perfect realization of all the non-coding regions in the genome?
japanese: もしグリーンがノンコーディング領域の部分的な解放を達成した存在で、またマーサーがそれ以上の何かであるならば、PARIAHはノンコーディング領域の全てを完全に具現化した存在なのでは？

english: It may be the final purpose of all life on earth.
japanese: そうだとしたら、それは地球上の全生物の最終目標と言えるんです。

english: So, you're wondering what PARIAH is to Elizabeth Greene?
japanese: それで、君はパリアがエリザベス・グリーンにとってどういう存在かというのが気になってるのか？

english: The more interesting question is this: what does PARIAH have in common with Alex Mercer?
japanese: もっと興味があるのはね、パリアとアレックス・マーサーとの共通点は何だ？ ってことだ。

english: I have my theories. Mercer might be the artificial activation of non-coding regions -- something achieved by genetic manipulation.
japanese: 私の考えでは、マーサーの場合はノンコーディング領域の人為的な活性化であろう。 遺伝子操作によってなされている現象だ。

english: PARIAH is a natural release of things buried in the Genome.
japanese: パリアはゲノムに眠っていたものの自然な発現だ。

english: I have a feeling it might be extraordinarily bad if they ever met, face to face.
japanese: 彼らが対面してしまうと非常にまずいことになる気がしてならんのだよ。

english: I’m not cleared to speak to you about that.
japanese: そのことについて話すことを許可されておりません。

english: What if the entire purpose of the Hope outbreak was to breed something new?
japanese: ホープでの感染の目的が新しいものを作り出すことだとしたら？

english: There were fourteen aborted attempts -- the Hope Children -- but only the final result, PARIAH, survived.
japanese: ホープの子供たちに対する14の試験が頓挫しましたが ―― 最終結果としてはパリアだけが生き残りました。

english: What if this is the start of such a change on a massive scale?
japanese: これが大規模な変化の始まりだとしたら？

english: As of today, we are folded under control of First Biological Warfare Command out of Ft. Detrick
japanese: 本日より我々はデトリック基地より発令された、第一次生物化学戦争令下におかれることになる。

english: They’re calling the shots on this. I don’t want any fuckin’ lip. They tell you to jump, you jump.
japanese: 指令権はあちらにある。 貴様らに一切の口応えは不要だ。 彼らが飛べと言ったら、飛ぶんだ。

english: Do not mistake these guys for dabblers. They have seen serious shit in the past.
japanese: 彼らを素人と思うなよ。 過去に地獄を見てきた男たちだ。

english: They grabbed an entire apartment block and dragged 'em into some holding pen they had set up.
They’re doin that all over the city.
Fuck. I’m starting to wonder when it’s our turn.
I bet you two cartons they have a hella bunch of missiles pointed right here at good 'ole N-Y-C.
Don’t sweat it. We won’t even know it when it happens.
Naw, I hear these operators are out of Maryland. Some fuckin’ division or another. Blacker than black, these fucks.
japanese: 今、こいつらオペレーターはMarylandにいないらしいぜ。 クソったれの部局かなんかめ。 黒よりも真っ黒だな、このクソどもは。

english: They got no rank, no fuckin’ protocol. They’re fuckin’ barbarians.
japanese: 奴らには階級もない、クソッタレな作戦計画書もない。 連中はクソッたれの未開人さ。
あいつらのせいだ。

english: They burned the damn thing to the ground. With the people in it.
This woman comes out on fire, and they just open up on her. And they’re just laughing. I’m telling you, these guys are fucking Nazis, man.
Are you telling me Washington can’t do anything? They’re declaring Martial Law! Don’t they need...?
Listen to me Harvey, they don’t need anything. They’re in charge. They’ve been doing this for years. To them this is just status quo.
This telephone call has been interrupted for national security reasons under the Emergency Powers act.

japanese: 報告を。

english: Sgt. Paulin and myself observed Marine Apache Charlie One head out of the cordon.
japanese: ポラン軍曹と自分は非常線の外へ向かう海兵隊アパッチC1を目撃しました。
それで？

english: We are fairly certain it was hijacked. When it was fired upon, we saw it.
japanese: ヘリは間違いなくハイジャックされたものでした。 そしてヘリが被弾したとき、我々はそれを見たのです
それとは？

english: Sir. The pilot. He...leaped out of the aircraft.
japanese: ヘリのパイロットです。 彼は……ヘリから飛び降りたんです。
それから？

english: He hit the ground running, sir.
japanese: 着地し走り去りました。

english: This ain’t just one guy, man. I’m telling you.
japanese: こいつが1人なわけないだろ。 な、そうだろ？

english: What the hell do YOU think is going on?
japanese: じゃ、なんだっていうんだ？

english: Gotta be a bunch of ’em, all in that hoodie get up, running around town, causing shit.
japanese: たくさんいるんだろ。 その全員があのフード姿で走り回って、町を荒らしてんだ。

english: WHY THE FUCK ARE THEY SHOOTING AT US! THEY’RE SUPPOSED TO BE ON OUR SIDE!
japanese: なんであいつら撃ってくんだよ！ 俺たちの味方だろ！？
くそ！ くそ！！

english: THAT IS IT, MAN. I'M OUTTA HERE. I'M GONNA SMOKE ANYTHING THAT AIN'T A MARINE.
japanese: そういうことかよ、やってられるか！ 海兵隊員以外は全員ぶっ殺してやる！！

english: EVERYONE! SHUT UP. I HAVE AN ANNOUNCEMENT!
japanese: 総員静かに！ 通達する。

english: First. These people infected with the virus -- they’re dead already. Keep your distance, and if they rush you, you shoot to kill.
japanese: 一つめ。 ウイルス感染者は既に死亡している。 距離を十分とり、もし奴らが走ってきたら射殺しろ。

english: CAP! WHEN’S THE CALVARY GETTING HERE!
japanese: 隊長！ 援軍が来るのはいつです？
二つめ。 援軍？ それが我々だ……。

english: Hey! Hey, blue boy! Get your men out of here.
japanese: おい！ おいお巡り！ お前の部下をここに呼べ！

english: Thank God, you guys are here....
japanese: やっとでおいでなすったか……
部下を呼べ！

english: Guys! We’re done. Let’s let the professionals handle it!
japanese: よし、仕事は終わりだ。あとはプロにお任せしようぜ。

english: You can't keep me here! I know my rights!
japanese: 俺を拘束できないはずだ！ 俺には権利がある！

english: Maybe, but you obviously don’t know much about Martial Law.
japanese: かもな。 だがお前は軍律についてはほとんど知っていないようだ。

english: You have the right to be ventilated. I have the right to burn your home and shoot your dog. Do you understand your rights as I have read them to you?
japanese: お前には新鮮な空気を吸う権利ならある。 俺にはお前の家を焼き、お前の犬を撃つ権利がある。 お前の権利について今の説明で理解できたか？
わかった！ わかったから！ 頼む！
じゃ、黙ってろ。

english: I've stopped this damn thing before.  Stopped it dead.
japanese: 私はこのイカれた状況を止めた事がある。 全員殺すことで。

english: Hope, Idaho, was just a...sacrificial lamb. A necessary cruelty.
japanese: アイダホ州ホープは……生贄の様なものだ。必要なことだった。

english: Shoot anything that moves. No one comes in, nothing gets out.
japanese: 動くものは全て撃て。 誰一人として出入りさせるな。

english: Sir, the Walkers have sealed themselves in the hospital.
japanese: ウォーカーが病院に立てこもりました。

english: We have orders to liquidate the entire population!
japanese: 私たちは全住人を消すという命を受けているんだ！

english: The mother and child are now military assets.
japanese: あの母子は軍の保護に置く。
そして私は将官になった……。

english: I’ve been through three wars in this tank. I can move through city streets or open desert -- ain’t nothing that can stop her.
And if anything gets in my way...well, damn, *laughs* I just go over it.
Welcome to the Marine Armor Training Center. There are nineteen major systems in this Marine Armored Personnel Carrier and over 25,000 moving parts.
japanese: ようこそ海兵隊装甲車両訓練所へ。 ここには19種の主要な海兵隊装甲車両が25,000以上も運用されている。

english: In the next eight months, you will learn ALL of them.
japanese: これからの9ヶ月間、諸君にはこれら全てを学んでもらう。

english: When you’re done here, you’ll be able to park that vehicle on top of an enemy position and blow the shit out of them. It’s my job to get your shit in order.
japanese: それが全て済んだ時には、諸君は敵陣地で装甲車を駆りクソったれをぶちのめせるだろう。 それをお前らにご教授してやるのが俺の仕事だ。

english: It's your job to shut the fuck up and learn.
japanese: で、お前らの仕事はこれを黙って脳ミソにブチ込むことだ。

english: This briefing is Class A One. The Federal Emergency Prosecution Act applies.
This is the situation as we understand it: The virus is centering around structures in the city we’ve designated HIVES.
The infected gather biological material at these strong-points for unknown reasons, possibly to generate new strains of the outbreak.
What we do know is this: the integrity of the building is stronger, but not immune to attack. A sustained attack of sufficient force on a Hive should destroy it.
We know Zeus has been spotted multiple times in this area and we're breaking out some new tech to pin him down.
japanese: ゼウスの姿はこのエリアで何回も確認されています。 そこで、ヤツを仕留めるために、新たな技術を導入しました。

english: This Unmanned Aerial Vehicle can detect the virus at less than ten parts per million in open air. With it, we should be able to box Zeus in and destroy it.
japanese: この無人飛行体は、大気中の濃度10ppm以下のウイルスを検知できます。 これがあれば、ゼウスを追い詰めて、仕留められるはずです。

english: The outbreaks seem to be centered around these areas. The focus, as we’ve seen, seems to be these buildings.
japanese: 集団感染の発生は、このエリアの中心にあるようだ。 我々が見てきたように、感染源はこのあたりの建物のようだ。

english: Secure all marked areas for possible insertion of Director McMullen for direct study. He won’t touch down until all sniffers read nominal, and make sure none are destroyed.
japanese: 研究の指導のためにマクマレン所長が立ち入る可能性のある全てのエリアを確保せよ。 彼は全ての（侵入）探知機が正常であり、何も破壊されていない事を確認しないと着陸しない。
エンゲージメント（戦闘、交戦）プロトコルって？

english: Anything it takes to clear the ground. When it’s all-clear, sound off.
japanese: 地上から敵を排除するものよ。 すべてが警戒解除されたら静かになるわ。

english: Sir, Director McMullen surrendered the bodies to a civilian.
japanese: マクマレン所長が死体を民間人に引き渡しました。
ラグランドか。
はい。

english: You did the right thing, son. Your new orders are this: recover ALL samples, bodies and evidence from Dr. Ragland. Bring them to Base AE-One.
japanese: お前が正しい。 新しい指令はこうだ、全サンプル、死体、証拠をラグランドから取り戻せ。 そしてそれをAE-1基地にまで持ってこい。
ラグランドは？

english: If he doesn’t interfere, leave him be. He’s already implicated. He won’t talk.
japanese: もし彼が抵抗しなければ放っておけ。 あいつはすでに巻き込まれてる、しゃべらないさ。
マクマレン所長はどうしますか？

english: It’s time for the Doctor to learn who’s in charge of this little excursion.
japanese: この計画を管理しているのが誰なのか知ってもらおうじゃないか。

english: All units, we’re going to Plan B. Return to all control points and rendezvous at the bridge at H-Hour.
We’re going over to Brooklyn...in armor -- fuck.
All of this, everything here. We’ve been preparing to fight the wrong war! We can’t beat this. We need to pull out and deal with it at a distance!
japanese: 全ての間違いはここから始まってるんです。我々はずっと間違った敵と戦ってきた。我々では倒せません。手を引いて距離を置いて攻撃するべきです。

english: Taggart, I put you in charge because I trust you to do what needs to be done: cut the heart out of the infection.
japanese: タガート、私がお前をこの任務につけたのはお前はやるべきことをやれる男だと私が信じたからだ。 感染源を断て。

english: Sir! The position is untenable. These...things...they’re...beyond our abilities....
japanese: その命には従いかねます。 あれは……彼らは……我々の手に負えません……。

english: I don’t want to hear one more excuse from you! You get your ass back into the field and get it done! Or don’t come back.
japanese: これ以上言い訳を聞く気はない！ 戦場に戻って任務を果たせ！ それまで帰還は許さん。

english: Sir, we've got a priority situation in New York.
japanese: 我々はニューヨークで優先すべき状況におかれています。
アイダホランナーのことか？
いえ、他のことです……。
どうされました？

english: Get the old man on the horn! I want two battalions ready to move from Detrick, full gear!
japanese: あの老いぼれ将軍に連絡しろ！ 2個大隊をデトリックから動かせと大至急でだ！ また始まるのか。

english: Yes, private, you’re guarding a hole in the fucking roof. You’ve been briefed about what we’re up against -- we’re not secure until these skylights are sealed.
japanese: いいか、二等兵。 お前はこのクソったれた屋根の穴を守ってる。 俺たちが直面しているものについては説明されているな。 あの天窓を封鎖するまでは安心出来ない。

english: So, unless you want to pull shit patrol until your momma forgets what you look like, stand your sorry ass right here until you're told to do otherwise. NOW MOVE IT!
japanese: それで、だ。 ママに忘れられちまうまでクソパトロールをしたくなかったら、お前の惨めなケツをここにブッ立ててろ。 さあ、やれ！
了解！
リム隊長！

english: At ease trooper. Get on the horn and tell them we've secured the Penn station bodies.
japanese: 楽にしろ。 彼らにペンシルバニア駅の死体は確保したと連絡してくれ。

english: I'm taking the heavy armor to destroy a Hive. Get control points up in this area then rendezvous with us at GENTEK.
japanese: 私はハイヴを潰すために重装甲車を呼ぶ。 この辺りを基点に、ジェンテックで合流だ。
了解！

english: Piloting a Grey Goose is a tough job. Swinging a 25,000 pound heli down to safe touchdown on Seventh Avenue, now that is another thing altogether.
japanese: グレイグースの操縦は難しい仕事だ。 だが25,000ポンドのヘリを7番街に無事着陸させるのとはまた別な話だ。

english: Lucky I'm just that damn good.
japanese: 良かったな、俺ならうまくできるぜ。
